Direct message the job poster from Putnam Recruiting Group
Caleb Dare
Technical Recruiter @ PRG
Snapshot:We are an early-stage fashion venture focused on building AR-driven dressing rooms w/ an AI-driven recommendation engine to drive e-commerce. We're building a revolutionary styling technology to solve one of the fashion industry's biggest issues — sustainability. The fashion industry is the second-largest carbon emissions polluter in the world, and with the rise of online shopping, waste and pollution continue to grow. We are looking to combat waste and reduce returns by creating a hyper-realistic virtual try-on and styling product that easily integrates into eCommerce sites and retail stores, allowing users to see what items will look like on their bodies without having to try them on in real life. We have an office located in West Hollywood and we ask folks to make it into the office at least four (4) days per week.Our team is working on the cutting edge of Computer Vision and Machine Learning (GANs, generative learning) building a product using the latest theories, rapid iterations, and collaboration. We are looking for a Data Science literate and experienced Engineering Manager/Leader who will actively mentor and contribute to the development of the team. You’re the perfect fit for this role if you get more excited about teaching people and watching them than you do about doing the work yourself. Who You Are:You love fostering career growth and building and supporting a strong team culture.You proactively identify problems as opportunities and generate creative approaches to resolve them.You enjoy working collaboratively with a Product Manager to build and maintain a backlog of work for a team of engineers.You can read and write Python 2 or Python 3 and know Python best practices.You know how to review code and deliver actionable feedback.You enjoy working leveraging public cloud technologies (GCP, AWS, etc.)You know best practices for deploying, troubleshooting, and maintaining Data Science-based systems in production.Responsibilities:Help your team design experiments to further our suite of Data Science projects.Evaluate the results of experiments both as they run and upon their completion to ensure we fail fast where we can.Help your team design a process to productionalize and release new models and new versions of existing models.Mentor members of your team and help expand their capabilities.Compensation and Benefits:We anticipate this role’s base salary to fall between $190,000 and $240,000 annually in addition to equity and benefits.401(k) with a 3% matchDental, Medical, Vision, and optional HSAUnlimited PTO
